children.subject: Idk EE 120 wasn't that easy for me. The material wasn't too hard to understand and assignments were instructive and medium workload to get through, but the curve was really tough. Even though I felt like I understood all concepts taught in lecture, the folks who tend to take the class are (I think) above average compared to the rest of the EECS population, so I wouldn't go in thinking easy A.

EE120 is easy in terms of workload -- definitely on the super light end when you compare to the likes of the other EECS upper divs. 6-7 homeworks, 4-5 juypter notebook labs, and thats it. I actually think the curve isn't too bad (B+/3.3 curve) having taken it with Babak this past semester. 

Anonymous Gear does have a point in being NO one takes EE120 without a clear interest in the EE side in one way or another. Similar to how 170 is a "must take" for CS majors, 120 is a "must take" for anyone interested in EE. I have seen no one taking EE120 "for fun" as with some people might take CS170 to prep for interviews or CS189 "just to learn" machine learning -- that means the population of students who does take EE120 are very strong in general, which makes the curve harder in that sense.

Gonna answer in the followup because I only have personal anecdotal data from 137B, but 137B is a very lightweight, chill, and enlightening class delving upon great detail within the premises of renewable energy, so yes this is THE class for that topic, going into things you may not have heard of as well, such as CSPs and flywheels. 1 problem set a week (much shorter and interesting than 16A/B psets) and a mini-research assignment at the end.

Every mention of EE120 I've heard has frequently also been accompanied by the word "easy", so I would not be too worried there.

history.content: Hello. I am very interested in smart grids, IoT, utility management and renewable energy. I might have to graduate a semester early to help my family financially. In that case, I would probably take EE 120 & EE 122 & EE 137B in on semester. Is this program feasible? These would be the only 3 classes I would be taking. Thanks for the comments and stay safe and well!
history.subject: EE 120 & EE 122 & EE 137B in one semester?
